job_description:
Front-End Developer / UI/UX Developer

We are seeking a skilled and motivated UI/UX Developer with at least one year of experience to join our team immediately. As a UI/UX Developer, you will have a good eye for design and a solid understanding of front-end development to turn creative ideas into functional and beautiful user interfaces.

Job Responsibilities:

  • Develop front-end interfaces using HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and modern frameworks like Vue.js to create responsive, interactive UIs.
  • Implement UI components with modern CSS, especially Tailwind CSS, ensuring consistency and usability.
  • Translate UI/UX designs into pixel-perfect code.
  • Integrate RESTful APIs and effectively handle response data.
  • Collaborate with designers, product managers, and backend developers.
  • Optimize applications for maximum speed and scalability.
  • Ensure design consistency and usability across different platforms and devices.
  • Implement user-centric solutions based on feedback and best practices.
  • Use Git for version control and participate in code reviews.
  • Stay up to date with the latest technology trends and best practices in React.js development, while keeping an eye out for potential new technology opportunities.

Job Requirements:

  • Minimum 1 year of proven experience in UI/UX development.
  • Strong knowledge of front-end web development with HTML5, CSS3, advanced JavaScript, and Tailwind CSS for responsive designs.
  • Strong understanding of responsive web design principles.
  • Experience with modern frameworks (Vue.js preferred).
  • Good understanding of UI/UX principles and performance optimization.
  • Solid experience working with REST APIs.
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Experience with version control systems like Git.
  • Good communication skills and a strong team player.
  • Basic understanding of Figma designs and UI implementation.
  • Ability to work independently and meet timelines.

Required Qualifications:

  • B.Tech / B.E. in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
  • Experience: 1 year.

Application Instructions:

Interested candidates are invited to submit their resume, portfolio, and a cover letter with the subject line: “Front-End Developer / UI/UX Developer Application”.

If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at hr@ynotinfo.com.
summary: Seeking a UI/UX Developer with 1+ year of experience in front-end development using modern frameworks like Vue.js and Tailwind CSS. Responsibilities include designing responsive UIs, integrating APIs, and collaborating with cross-functional teams.

The role involves overseeing multi-entity finance operations across India, UAE, and UK, establishing effective financial systems, ensuring compliance, and supporting the group's rapid growth through cost control and sustainable financial infrastructures.

Requirements - Minimum of 7 years of experience in financial management, preferably within technology companies or startups. - Experience with multi-entity or international financial operations is an added advantage. - Full knowledge of international accounting standards (IFRS) and UAE tax and insurance regulations; knowledge of India and UK regulations is an additional advantage. - Ability to design and implement cost accounting systems and cost control processes. - Strong analytical skills in financial data analysis and accurate management reporting. - Proficiency in English (knowledge of other languages, especially Malayalam, is a plus). - Strong leadership, planning, and strategic decision-making abilities.

job_description:
Job Title: System Validation Engineer Experience: 5+ years Job Type: Contractual / Temporary Work Location: Remote Prefer Immediate Joiners

Role Purpose

Execute computer system validation (CSV) activities to ensure regulated systems are compliant, fit for intended use, and approved for production.

Compliance Scope

  • ICH E6 (GCP), FDA 21 CFR Part 11, EU Annex 11, GDPR, HIPAA, ISO 9001, ISO 27001, GAMP 5

Core Responsibilities

  • Author and maintain Validation Plan defining scope, deliverables, testing strategy, acceptance criteria, and responsibilities.
  • Review and approve System Design Documentation (architecture, infrastructure, database, interfaces, configuration).
  • Develop Testing Plan and author/pre-approve Validation Protocols (IQ/OQ/PQ) with defined steps and expected results.
  • Execute or oversee validation testing on production or equivalent systems; document and approve results.
  • Review Code Review Reports and verify Unit Test Results for development compliance.
  • Manage Validation Incident Reports, including impact assessment, corrective actions, regression testing, and closure.
  • Maintain Traceability Matrices (URS → FRS → Design → Tests) ensuring complete coverage.
  • Prepare Testing Summary Report and Validation Summary Report authorizing production release.
  • Support Deployment Plan execution and perform Installation Qualification (IQ); ensure IQ reusability.

Required Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, IT, or equivalent.
  • Proven experience in CSV within regulated (GxP) environments.
  • Strong knowledge of SDLC, risk-based validation, and validation documentation.

Key Skills

  • Technical documentation, system architecture understanding, compliance focus, cross-functional collaboration.

Preferred Skills

  • ERP/LIMS/QMS/MES validation, electronic records/signatures, audit and inspection support.

Contact Information

Interested candidates can mail their resume to careers@appsteamtechnologies.com with the subject line "System Validation Engineer Application".
summary: System Validation Engineer with 5+ years required to execute CSV activities ensuring compliance with GAMP 5, FDA 21 CFR Part 11, and other regulations. Responsibilities include validation planning, testing, and documentation for production systems.

job_title: Executive Assistant to CEO & Office Operations Coordinator
job_description:
Executive Assistant to CEO & Office Operations Coordinator

Location: Trivandrum only (Work from office) Experience: 1–3 years Role Type: Full-time | Confidential support

About Us

LTS is a leading Operational Excellence and Lean Industry 4.0 software company, building digital platforms that power execution for large, complex organisations worldwide. Headquartered in the United Kingdom, we have spent over a decade establishing a strong position in the Lean and Leadership 4.0 space, delivering enterprise solutions used by global organisations, including Fortune 500 companies. Our products help move Lean from frameworks into daily execution by combining deep domain expertise with scalable, modern software. With teams across India, Germany, Poland, the United States, the UAE, Jordan, and Mexico, LTS continues to gain momentum as organisations accelerate their digital and people-centric transformation initiatives.

Why You Will Love Working With Us

  • Opportunity to build a career in a specialised, high-impact B2B software domain.
  • Work on globally deployed enterprise products used by large organisations, including Fortune 500 companies.
  • Gain early exposure to international clients and cross-cultural teams across multiple regions.
  • Build and scale purpose-driven technology that solves real operational and leadership challenges.
  • Grow faster in a company expanding its products, customers, and global footprint.
  • Work in a respectful, people-first culture that values ownership, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

About the Role

We are seeking a trustworthy, detail-oriented, and proactive Executive Assistant to CEO & Office Operations Coordinator to support the CEO across day-to-day executive coordination, documentation, procurement, office operations tracking, and statutory compliance coordination. This role requires strong follow-up discipline, excellent organisation skills, and hands-on comfort with MS365 and Excel. At LTS, transaction volume is limited, but execution quality is critical. Your success will be measured by closures, on-time compliance, smooth office operations, and reduced operational load on the CEO. Training will be provided for internal processes and workflows such as PF/ESI/GST/Softex/basic accounts coordination.

Key Responsibilities

A) CEO Office / Executive Assistance - Manage the CEO’s calendar, meetings, priorities, reminders, and day-to-day coordination. - Prepare structured Minutes of Meetings (MoMs) with clear action items, owners, and timelines. - Maintain an Action Tracker and ensure closures through disciplined follow-ups. - Draft emails/messages, prepare documents, and ensure systematic record-keeping with confidentiality.

B) Compliance Coordination (with CA/Consultants) - Coordinate statutory compliance workflows and timelines: PF, ESI, GST, Softex (document collection, tracking, proof storage). - Track payment due dates, challans/acknowledgements, and maintain clean compliance folders (SharePoint/OneDrive).

C) Procurement, Renewals & Payments Support - Own routine procurement coordination: quotations, comparisons, ordering, delivery follow-up, and invoice collection (including bi-weekly stationery needs). - Maintain trackers for payments, renewals, vendors, invoices, and ensure proper documentation for each transaction. - Prepare periodic summaries for CEO: upcoming renewals, pending payments, procurement status, and exceptions requiring approval.

D) Office Operations & Asset Coordination (Ownership + Tracking) - Maintain an accurate asset register (laptops/monitors/furniture/other equipment); support tagging, issue/return tracking during onboarding and exit. - Coordinate office maintenance via vendors (internet/AC/electrical/plumbing/general maintenance): raise requests, follow up, and track closure. - Ensure availability of office consumables/stationery through scheduled procurement; maintain stock/consumption trackers. - Coordinate courier/dispatch, scanning/printing, and systematic filing (SharePoint/OneDrive). - Ensure meeting rooms are ready (setup coordination, projector/cables/printers as needed) and support internal events/celebrations when required. - Handle occasional external coordination tasks (bank/courier/vendor pickup) if needed.

E) HR Coordination Support (as needed) - Support HR in coordination activities such as interview scheduling, documentation, and onboarding checklists—while minimising CEO involvement in routine HR steps.

Preferred Skills

  • Experience: 1–3 years experience as an Executive Assistant / Admin Assistant / Office Coordinator / Operations Coordinator (preferably in a small-to-mid sized company).
  • Education: Graduate in any discipline.
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills.
  • Hands-on experience with MS365 (Outlook, Teams, Word, OneDrive/SharePoint, PowerPoint, Excel).
  • Strong Excel skills (filters, lookups, trackers; advanced formulas are a plus).

Company Information

Job Overview

Software Engineer - Closing Date: 31, Dec 2025 - Job Published: 17, Dec 2025 - Location: Dubai - Contact Email: mail@nagainfo.com

Brief Description

We’re seeking an experienced Software Engineer with strong expertise in Apache NiFi and enterprise data flows for a high-impact project in Dubai. The role involves designing, developing, and optimizing production-grade data pipelines in a secure, high-performance environment.

Role Highlights

  • Lead the design, development, and optimization of complex Apache NiFi data flows.
  • Work with Cloudera NiFi (CDP Data Flow) and integrate with Cloudera Manager.
  • Ensure secure, high-availability NiFi deployments and monitor performance using Prometheus/Grafana.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement best practices for enterprise data pipelines.

Key Responsibilities

  • Design, implement, and optimize NiFi flows in production environments.
  • Migrate NiFi flows across major version upgrades while maintaining backward compatibility.
  • Develop scripts using Groovy for ExecuteScript and InvokeScriptedProcessor processors.
  • Integrate NiFi with MongoDB and Apache Kafka, handling data ingestion, transformation, and schema evolution.
  • Implement secure data handling using processors like EncryptContent and manage SFTP/SSH connections.
  • Monitor and troubleshoot NiFi flows using Data Provenance, bulletins, and log analysis.
  • Participate in setting up secure NiFi clusters, user authentication, TLS certificates, and access policies.

Skills Required

  • Hands-on experience with Apache NiFi and Cloudera NiFi (CDP Data Flow)
  • Strong Groovy scripting skills for NiFi processors
  • Knowledge of SSH/SFTP protocols, secure file handling, and encryption mechanisms
  • Experience with MongoDB (GetMongo, PutMongo, QueryMongo)
  • Experience with Apache Kafka (Produce/Consume, Confluent Schema Registry)
  • Proficient in RHEL environments and JVM tuning for NiFi
  • Expertise in NiFi flow design principles, controller services, parameter contexts, and NiFi Registry

Good to Have

  • Custom processor development in Java/Groovy
  • Familiarity with DevOps workflows, CI/CD, and automated deployment strategies
  • Experience in regulated or secure environments with audit and compliance requirements
  • Strong documentation and mentoring skills

How to Apply

Interested candidates may send their CVs to mail@nagainfo.com.
summary: Seeking a Software Engineer with 5+ years in Apache NiFi and enterprise data flows to design and optimize secure, high-performance data pipelines in Dubai. Requires expertise in Cloudera NiFi, Groovy scripting, and integration with MongoDB/Kafka.

About the Opportunity

DeviceDriven seeks a Senior DevOps / SRE Engineer to build, operate, and improve a reliable, secure, and scalable cloud platform using GCP, Kubernetes, Infrastructure-as-Code, and GitOps practices. This role emphasizes production ownership, automation, and reliability engineering with hands-on system operations.

Role Overview

We require a hands-on DevOps/SRE engineer with expertise in: - Cloud infrastructure (primarily GCP) - Kubernetes-based platforms - Terraform and automation - CI/CD pipelines - Observability, incident response, and reliability engineering

Key Responsibilities

Cloud Infrastructure & Operations (GCP + Multi-Cloud)

  • Operate cloud infrastructure across dev, staging, and production environments.
  • Implement networking, IAM, security, and compute resources on GCP.
  • Support multi-cloud workloads (AWS/Azure exposure preferred).
  • Participate in capacity planning and cost optimization.

Infrastructure-as-Code & Automation

  • Build infrastructure using Terraform.
  • Contribute to reusable Terraform modules and IaC standards.
  • Automate provisioning, updates, and validations.
  • Migrate legacy setups to automated IaC workflows.

Kubernetes & Platform Engineering

  • Support rollout strategies (rolling, blue-green, canary).

CI/CD & GitOps

  • Build CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, etc.).
  • Automate build, test, and deployment workflows.

SRE: Reliability, Observability & Incident Management

  • Define SLIs/SLOs for critical services.

Security & Compliance Support

Programming & Scripting: - Bash proficiency. - Python or Go knowledge for automation/debugging.

Nice to Have: - Fintech or regulated environment experience. - AWS/Azure production exposure. - Platform engineering or internal developer tooling. - Incident management frameworks and postmortems.

How to Apply

Send your resume, GitHub/LinkedIn profile, and a short interest note to: Jobs@devicedriven.com
